intro: Cullumia patula, commonly known as the narrowleaf cullumia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are usually pink or white, blooming in late spring to early summer. It has a low-growing, mat-forming habit and is often found in open woodlands and mountainous regions. Cullumia patula is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting local wildlife.
